title: 104_hr2152
content: The curr_chunk discusses the requirements for a joint resolution of approval related to recommendations from the Independent Commission on Medicare. It must be introduced within a specific timeframe, have a specific format without a preamble, and include a resolution clause approving the recommendations for controlling outlays under the Medicare program for a specific fiscal year. The curr_chunk outlines the procedures for considering a joint resolution of approval regarding recommendations from the Independent Commission on Medicare. It references the Defense Base Closure and Realignment Act of 1990 for guidance on the process. The curr_chunk clarifies that references to specific committees in the House of Representatives and Senate will be determined by the Speaker and majority leader respectively. It also specifies that the date of report submission by the Commission will be considered the same as the date of the President's report transmission. SEC. 104 states that the Commission will not be terminated under the Federal Advisory Committee Act. TITLE II focuses on controlling outlays under the Medicare program, establishing annual limits on outlays, and enforcing limits through sequestration. Sequestration may occur if Congress fails to pass a resolution to address budget excess in the Medicare program. This involves reducing Medicare outlays to align with the established limits set by Congress. The President has the authority to reduce Medicare payments and increase premiums, deductibles, copayments, and coinsurance by a uniform percentage to address budget excess. Sequestration of amounts under this section follows specific guidelines outlined in the legislation. Sequestration of amounts under this section follows specific guidelines outlined in the legislation, including reports issued by OMB and CBO on estimated amounts and percentages for the fiscal year. Rules for the application of reductions are also specified. The table of contents for part C of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 is amended by inserting a new section after section 252. "Sequestration with respect to medicare."
